channel.title: Alejandro Granados on Home
channel.description: Recent content in Alejandro Granados on Home

item.title: Twitter sentiment analysis using spaCy
item.description:
This project consists of the following steps:

  • Create spacy pipeline using linear regression model
  • Train the pipeline with data from IMDB reviews
  • Download 3k tweets for a specified Twitter user
  • Use the pipeline to predict sentiment for each tweet
  • Visualize sentiment as time series using a 7-day moving average

item.title: LSTM time-series forecasting
item.description:
This project consists of:

  • Read data for stock prices since Jan 2000. We are using Microsoft stock.
  • Transforming the time-series data into a classification problem.
  • Stacked LSTM model with TensorFlow
  • Accuracy in forecasting measured by MSE

item.title: A gaming laptop for Data Science and ML?
item.description: For a long time, gaming laptops were known for being extravagant, expensive, large, noisy, prone to overheating, and expensive. Crafted for a specific market of consumers that value the video game experience more than reality, these powerful machines had really no other use.

item.title: Financial data acquisition with R
item.description: The stock market is a complex system with multiple interesting attributes for data science: dynamics, correlations and stochastic behaviour.

item.title: Financial data acquisition with R
item.description: The stock market is a complex system with multiple interesting attributes for data science: dynamics, correlations and stochastic behaviour.

item.title: Making an interactive 3D UMAP plot
item.description:
An interactive 3D UMAP plot using plotly.

UMAP plots have become the standard for representing single-cell RNA seq data. If you are not using UMAP and still using tSNE, you should stop. Right now. UMAP plots succesfully represent not only the clusters in the high-dimensional space but also the relationships between the clusters. Which is really important when analysing development datasets.

item.title: COVID19 Cases in Real time
item.description: The dataset: Time series data for COVID19 worldwide. Updated daily. This analysis builds up on the amazing work and ideas by Tomas Pueyo. Pueyo’s original publication features a public dataset compiled by John Hopkins University.

item.title: Clubes de Ciencia Mexico
item.description: A Data Science workshop for analysis of biological data. Ciencia de datos. Datos de células. ¿Células de datos? Hoy en día es casi imposible no escuchar hablar de datos. Los datos están en todos lados y nos ayudan a entender y predecir cómo funcionan las cosas. En este club aprenderemos conceptos clave de la ciencia de datos como clustering y reducción de dimensionalidad en el contexto de la expresión genética de células.
